members.name: arrowElement
members.description: The arrow pointing from the popover to the anchor element.

members.name: maxWidth
members.description: The max width of the popover.

members.name: offset
members.description: The offset of the popover to its anchor.

members.name: position
members.description: The main position of the popover relative to the anchor.

methods.name: #linkAnchorWithPopover
methods.description:
Normally when using the `popovertarget` attribute with popovers,
the browser will automatically set the `aria-details` attribute on
the anchor element and `aria-expanded` on the trigger. But since we
cannot use the `popovertarget` attribute in combination with custom
elements, we need to set these ourselves.

fields.name: arrowElement
fields.description: The arrow pointing from the popover to the anchor element.

fields.name: arrowPadding
fields.description: The padding of the arrow.

fields.description: The offset of the popover to its anchor.

fields.name: maxWidth
fields.description: The max width of the popover.

fields.name: position
fields.description: The main position of the popover relative to the anchor.

members.name: multiple
members.description: Whether more than 1 item can be selected at a time.

members.name: size
members.description: The total number of items in the selection.

fields.name: #selectAll
fields.description: Whether all items are selected or not.

fields.name: #selection
fields.description:
The current selection; these are either the selected items, or the unselected items,
depending on the value of #selectAll.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The total number of items in the selection.

fields.name: multiple
fields.description: Whether more than 1 item can be selected at a time.

members.name: filteredItems
members.description: The filtered & sorted array of items.

members.name: removeGroupBy
members.description: Remove the groupBy attribute. This will cause the data to be sorted as if it was not grouped.

members.name: setGroupBy
members.description:
Group the items by the given path. Optionally, you can provide a sorter and direction.

This is part of the DataSource interface, because it changes how the data is sorted. You
may want to pass the groupBy attribute to the server, so it can sort the data for you.

members.name: size
members.description: Total number of items in this data source.

methods.name: setGroupBy
methods.description:
Group the items by the given path. Optionally, you can provide a sorter and direction.

This is part of the DataSource interface, because it changes how the data is sorted. You
may want to pass the groupBy attribute to the server, so it can sort the data for you.

methods.description: Remove the groupBy attribute. This will cause the data to be sorted as if it was not grouped.

fields.name: #filters
fields.description: Map of all active filters.

fields.name: #groupBy
fields.description: Order the items by grouping them on the given attributes.

fields.name: #sort
fields.description:
The value and path/function to use for sorting. When setting this property,
it will cause the data to be automatically sorted.

declarations.name: decorateProperty

parameters.description:
Optional finisher method; receives the element
constructor and property key as arguments and has no return value.
parameters.name: finisher

parameters.description:
Optional descriptor method; receives the
property key as an argument and returns a property descriptor to define for
the given property.
parameters.name: descriptor

declarations.description:
Helper for decorating a property that is compatible with both TypeScript
and Babel decorators. The optional `finisher` can be used to perform work on
the class. The optional `descriptor` should return a PropertyDescriptor
to install for the given property.

declarations.name: camelize
declarations.description:
Returns the lowerCamelCase form of a string.

```javascript
camelize('innerHTML')          // 'innerHTML'
camelize('action_name')        // 'actionName'
camelize('css-class-name')     // 'cssClassName'
camelize('object.path.name')   // 'objectPathName'
camelize('my favorite items')  // 'myFavoriteItems'
camelize('My Favorite Items')  // 'myFavoriteItems'
```

declarations.name: capitalize
declarations.description:
Returns the Capitalized form of a string

```javascript
capitalize('innerHTML')         // 'InnerHTML'
capitalize('action_name')       // 'Action_name'
capitalize('css-class-name')    // 'Css-class-name'
capitalize('my favorite items') // 'My favorite items'
```

declarations.name: classify
declarations.description:
Returns the UpperCamelCase form of a string.

```javascript
classify('innerHTML')          // 'InnerHTML'
classify('action_name')        // 'ActionName'
classify('css-class-name')     // 'CssClassName'
classify('my favorite items')  // 'MyFavoriteItems'
```

declarations.name: dasherize
declarations.description:
Replaces underscores, spaces, or camelCase with dashes.

```javascript
dasherize('innerHTML')         // 'inner-html'
dasherize('action_name')       // 'action-name'
dasherize('css-class-name')    // 'css-class-name'
dasherize('my favorite items') // 'my-favorite-items'
```

declarations.name: decamelize
declarations.description:
Converts a camelized string into all lower case separated by underscores.

```javascript
decamelize('innerHTML')         // 'inner_html'
decamelize('action_name')       // 'action_name'
decamelize('css-class-name')    // 'css-class-name'
decamelize('my favorite items') // 'my favorite items'
```

declarations.name: humanize
declarations.description:
Returns the Humanized form of a string

```javascript
humanize('innerHTML')         // 'Inner html'
humanize('action_name')       // 'Action name'
humanize('css-class-name')    // 'Css class name'
humanize('my favorite items') // 'My favorite items'
```

declarations.name: underscore
declarations.description:
More general than decamelize. Returns the lower\_case\_and\_underscored
form of a string.

```javascript
underscore('innerHTML')          // 'inner_html'
underscore('action_name')        // 'action_name'
underscore('css-class-name')     // 'css_class_name'
underscore('my favorite items')  // 'my_favorite_items'
```

declarations.name: createKeybindingsHandler
declarations.description: Creates an event listener for handling keybindings.

declarations.name: parseKeybinding
declarations.description:
Parses a "Key Binding String" into its parts

grammar    = `<sequence>`
<sequence> = `<press> <press> <press> ...`
<press>    = `<key>` or `<mods>+<key>`
<mods>     = `<mod>+<mod>+...`

declarations.name: tinykeys
declarations.description:
Subscribes to keybindings.

Returns an unsubscribe method.
